what: Common design features of the data set
title: The Data
text: essentially four families tables data: Learning structure tables, containing data subjects, sessions details. tables include data teaching sessions, campus_codes, offerings subjects available. Student enrolment tables. detail details student enrolment university. Student characteristics contained student_ids student_demographics, details course subject enrolments contained student_course enrolments, respectively. Student learning tables. record student enrolled. detail students activity subject sites LMS trace data, performance via assessment_marks overall subject [grades]. Additionally data students decide exit university done . Retention team campaign tables. tables record data pertinent activities interventions Retention Team. includes lists students utilised embedded_tutors, raised flags -risk, triggers used identify -risk students, kind contact made students. key table interventions table, attempts summarise tables one, hopefully practical, place.

previous_headings: Common design features of the data set
title: The Data
text: key part cleaning processing data consistent names variables throughout tables. commonly used keys making joins. id : Unique student ID (character). Sometimes student multiple ID’s, re-enrolled. case numeric part ID , B appended end. session : Unique ID teaching session (numeric). first four digits year, last two correspond year session runs. main three teaching sessions end 30, 60, 90. E.g. 202230 first main teaching session 2022. year : calendar year. subject : six character subject code (unit study), form ABC123. offering : offering code. offering subject (unit study) taught particular session particular campus delivered particular mode (Internal Distinace). code form ABC123_202230_PT_I, denoting subject, session, campus mode, separated _. campaign : particular intervention ‘campaign’ data relates . Details values outlined notes flags table.

title: The Data
text: table gives academic results student (id), subject session. grade final grade student received subject. mark percentage score student achieved. Lots data missing (97%) mark_bb attempt get estimate student’s mark LMS data. lot data also missing (42%). looking best guess mark worth coalescing mark mark_bb, far data incomplete grade_original indicates first grade student achieved subject. Sometimes ‘admin override’ grade, grade_original different grade indicates override occurred.

title: The Data
text: historic data, available three main sessions 2019, HEPPP subjects sessions. eai indicates mark student received Early Assessment Item. cm indicates students’ course mark. mean_mark indicates average mark student received assessments (unweighted). submit_ratio indicates ratio assessments submitted assessments required subject.

title: The Data
text: data collects together assessments, grades cumulative marks selected subjects. row result particular assessment item (title), student id, given subject, given session. marks numeric categorical (grades, pass / fail items). title name assessment. three special items, Calculated Grade, Administrative Override Cumulative Mark. Calculated Grade assessment mark, rather students’ final grade, appears LMS (may always match official grade). grade overwritten, stored Administrative Override. Cumulative Mark numeric mark student received, weighted assessment marks, used calculate grade. week_due week assessment due. value value assessment (contribution total 100 marks Cumulative Mark). assessments required pass, weighting, value 0. eai indicated assessment item used Early Assessment Item part pre census campaign identify disengaged students. threshold_mark includes value particular assessment item requires minimum mark order student pass subject. threshold_mark 0 indicates item must submitted, required numeric value achieve. mertric indicates assessment item assessed; instance numeric score . taken directly assessment item header LMS. grade assessments grade (categorical, blank otherwise) bb_pk1 primary key LMS data base (Blackboard) matches assessment item. possible always match academic deletes item recreates . score numeric score assessment item (numeric, blank otherwise). out_of maximum score achieved assessment item (numeric, blank otherwise). score_p % score assessment item (numeric, blank otherwise). sy_us indicates Satisfactory (SY) Unsatisfactory (US) grade, assessment marked.

title: The Data
text: component various intervention campaigns run Retention Team involve communication students. table attempts draw together records different types contact happened, , , went. one row per contact attempt, particular student id, session, campaign, particular time (contact_timestamp). dialogue indicates outreach team meaningful conversation student. contact_type method contact, usually call, sms email. contact_date day contact made. contact_timestamp timestamp contact recorded (data filled end conversation, might little delay). earliest_flag indicates earliest flag student contacted . title: The Data
text: part intervention campaigns students may flagged ‘-risk’ reason. recorded flags table. row particular concern, student id, subject / offering, particular session particular campaign. also identified occured, however data inconsistently recorded years may week, flag_timestamp trigger_date. campaign indicates Retention Team campaigns flag belongs . early low engagement campaign run week two session identifies students subject site access since beginning session, friendly email sent. pre census campaign run weeks 3 4, census date, identifying students higher risk failure select number subjects. Students contacted outreach team. similar campaign run 2020 census date, called post census campaign. persistent low engagement campaign run just census date, strongly worded contact students still subject site access days census date. non genuine students campaign run census, disengaged students withdraw subjects prior census. former fail campaign longer run retention team, early contact students performed poorly prior session. trigger_date indicates flag intended triggered, due date early assessment item. concern indicates flag raised. can depend campaign. pre census campaign usually low activity period inactivity subject site, non submission submitting early assessment item. former fail campaign (longer running) always prior performance. non genuine students campaign variety concerns, hopefully explaining clearly student put list. flag_timestamp indicates flag happened, data available (78.8% complete) week indicates week session flag raised. flag_timestamp missing often instead. concern_detail information pertinent flag. reason_for_no_upload indicates reason particular flag forwarded onto outreach team. usually student already flagged campaign risk.

title: The Data
text: query run Blackboard DDA public schema table.
code: /* aa by-day */ select id                                                           as id,        replace(coalesce(child_course_id, course_id), 'S-', '')      as offering,        date                                                         as date,        count(distinct session_id)                                   as logins,        count(session_id)                                            as clicks,        count(distinct content_pk1)                                  as views  from (select u.student_id                       as id,              cm.course_id                       as course_id,              cmchild.course_id                  as child_course_id,              aa.session_id                      as session_id,              aa.timestamp::date                 as date,              aa.content_pk1                     as content_pk1       from activity_accumulator aa                inner join users u on u.pk1 = aa.user_pk1                inner join course_main cm on aa.course_pk1 = cm.pk1                inner join course_users cu on cu.crsmain_pk1 = cm.pk1 and u.pk1 = cu.users_pk1                left join course_main cmchild on cmchild.pk1 = cu.child_crsmain_pk1       where u.student_id is not null         and cu.role = 'S'         and u.lastname not like '%PreviewUser'         and aa.event_type != 'SESSION_TIMEOUT'         and cm.course_id similar to 'S-%202290%'          and aa.timestamp::date >= make_date(2023, 2, 1) -- one month at a time         and aa.timestamp::date < make_date(2023, 3,  1)         ) as tab1 group by id, offering, date;

title: The Data
text: date day form submitted. program course code (yes program study course Charles Sturt.) faculty_program faculty runs course. study_mode self reported mode study. contact_request - student want contacted regarding decision? discuss_further - available recent surveys, answers question willing contacted discuss CSU experience? discuss_csu - student discuss decision anyone CSU? who_discuss_csu - discuss decision CSU? discuss_outside - student discuss decision anyone outside CSU? who_discuss_outside - else discuss decision ? withdraw_prior_commencement - student withdraw prior commencing study? factors_not_to_commence - reasons commencing, selected drop list. factors_leave - reasons leaving, selected drop list. factors_withdraw - reasons withdrawing, selected drop list. factors - factors , collected together. other_info contains free text comments.

text: may also want compare grade distributions different groups. instance, table flags interventions include data students flagged concern various campaigns, immediate results intervention. toy data included package simulated sample based pre-census campaign students called flagged ‘-risk’. answer phone call, .
code: academic |>      inner_join( # only including subjects from the flags list         flags |>              distinct(subject)     ) |>      left_join(         flags |>              mutate(flagged = TRUE)     ) |>      mutate(flagged = replace_na(flagged, FALSE)) |>      mutate(grp = if_else(flagged, "Low engagement", "Engaged")) |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      filter(grade_substantive) |>      ggplot(aes(x = grade, fill = grade_success)) +     geom_histogram(stat = "count") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours, guide = NULL) +     facet_wrap(~grp, scales = "free_y") #> Joining, by = "subject" #> Joining, by = c("id", "subject") #> Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count"): Ignoring unknown parameters: #> `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad` academic |>      inner_join( # only including subjects from the flags list         flags |>              distinct(subject)     ) |>      left_join(         flags |>              mutate(flagged = TRUE)     ) |>      mutate(flagged = replace_na(flagged, FALSE)) |>      left_join(interventions) |>      mutate(grp = case_when(         !flagged ~ "Engaged",         intervention_result == "dialogue" ~ "Spoke with disengaged student",         intervention_result == "no dialogue" ~ "Disengaged student did not answer") |>              fct_relevel("Engaged", "Spoke with disengaged student")) |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      filter(grade_substantive) |>      ggplot(aes(x = grade, fill = grp, alpha = grade_success)) +     geom_histogram(stat = "count") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours, guide = NULL) +     scale_alpha_discrete(range = c(1, 0.5), guide = NULL) +     facet_wrap(~grp, scales = "free_y") #> Joining, by = "subject" #> Joining, by = c("id", "subject") #> Joining, by = "id" #> Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count"): Ignoring unknown parameters: #> `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad` #> Warning: Using alpha for a discrete variable is not advised.

title: Visualisation
text: interventions (campaign toy data least) performed student-session level, grades reported student-session-subject level. can useful aggregate grades student-session-subject student-session level.
code: # aggregating at student-session progress rate academic_summary_1 <-      academic |>      mutate(session = "Session 1") |> # normally session would be included     group_by(id, session) |>     add_grade_helpers() |>      summarise(         progress_rate = sum(grade_success) / sum(grade_substantive),         gpa = gpa(grade)     ) |>      ungroup() #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'id'. You can override using the `.groups` #> argument.      academic_summary_1 |>      left_join(interventions) |>     mutate(grp = case_when(         is.na(intervention_result)  ~ "Engaged",         intervention_result == "dialogue" ~ "Spoke with disengaged student",         intervention_result == "no dialogue" ~ "Disengaged student did not answer") |>              fct_relevel("Engaged", "Spoke with disengaged student"))|>      ggplot(aes(x = gpa, colour = grp)) +     stat_ecdf(size = 2, alpha = 0.8) +     scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(),                        name = "Cumulative distribution") +     theme_minimal() +     scale_color_manual(values = csu_colours) #> Joining, by = "id" #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> Warning: Removed 333 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_ecdf()`). # aggregating by the custom `summarise_academic` function academic_summary_2 <-      academic |>      mutate(session = "Session 1") |> # normally session would be included     group_by(id, session) |>     summarise_academic()        glimpse(academic_summary_2) #> Rows: 1,876 #> Columns: 4 #> $ id          <chr> "Student10", "Student1001", "Student1003", "Student1005", … #> $ session     <chr> "Session 1", "Session 1", "Session 1", "Session 1", "Sessi… #> $ result_long <fct> Pass all, Pass all, Pass all, Passing (some non-zero fails… #> $ result      <fct> Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Pass, Non-…  academic_summary_2 |>      left_join(interventions) |>     mutate(grp = case_when(         is.na(intervention_result)  ~ "Engaged",         intervention_result == "dialogue" ~ "Spoke with disengaged student",         intervention_result == "no dialogue" ~ "Disengaged student did not answer") |>              fct_relevel("Engaged", "Spoke with disengaged student"))|>      ggplot(aes(x = 1, fill = result)) +     geom_bar(stat = "count", position = "stack") +     facet_wrap(~grp, scales = "free_y") +     theme_minimal() +     theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(), axis.title.x = element_blank()) +     scale_fill_manual(values = csu_colours) #> Joining, by = "id"

title: Working-with-academic-data
text: series useful functions prefix add_grade_*. function add_grade_helpers adds data frame grade field: Note grade_zf grade_npe identical. sometimes used term Zero-fail Non-Participating Enrolment indicate thing - failing grade student also received mark 0 (FNS grade). want particular field appended data frame use add_grade_* instead: instance, might want count grade distribution substantive (finalised counting towards progress)
code: some_sample_grades <-      tibble(grade = c("FL", "FNS", "PS", "PS", "HD", "GP", "ZZ"))  some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_helpers() #> # A tibble: 7 × 7 #>   grade grade_substantive grade_success grade_gpa grade_fail grade_zf grade_npe #>   <chr> <lgl>             <lgl>         <lgl>     <lgl>      <lgl>    <lgl>     #> 1 FL    TRUE              FALSE         TRUE      TRUE       FALSE    FALSE     #> 2 FNS   TRUE              FALSE         TRUE      TRUE       TRUE     TRUE      #> 3 PS    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 4 PS    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 5 HD    TRUE              TRUE          TRUE      FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 6 GP    FALSE             FALSE         FALSE     FALSE      FALSE    FALSE     #> 7 ZZ    FALSE             FALSE         FALSE     FALSE      FALSE    FALSE some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_substantive() |>      add_grade_success() #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   grade grade_substantive grade_success #>   <chr> <lgl>             <lgl>         #> 1 FL    TRUE              FALSE         #> 2 FNS   TRUE              FALSE         #> 3 PS    TRUE              TRUE          #> 4 PS    TRUE              TRUE          #> 5 HD    TRUE              TRUE          #> 6 GP    FALSE             FALSE         #> 7 ZZ    FALSE             FALSE

title: Working-with-academic-data
text: helpers can used calculate aggregates grades, progress rates GPA (using gpa function). Additionally, function retention.helpers::summarise_academic() aggregates set grades two descriptions, result result_long. makes sense use grouped data frame.
code: some_sample_grades |>      add_grade_helpers() |>      summarise(         progress_rate = sum(grade_success) / sum(grade_substantive),         gpa = gpa(grade)     ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   progress_rate   gpa #>           <dbl> <dbl> #> 1           0.6     5 tibble(     student = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "B"),     grade = c("PS", "DI", "FNS", "FL", "PS")) |>      group_by(student) |>      summarise_academic() #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   student result_long       result     #>   <chr>   <fct>             <fct>      #> 1 A       Pass all          Pass       #> 2 B       Failing (some ZF) Partial ZF

title: Working-with-enrolments
text: Enrolments come two levels Charles Sturt University; course subject. Course enrolments refer students’ enrolment particular program study, Bachelor Nursing. stored student_course table. Subject level enrolments stored enrolments table, correspond enrolment records units study particular session. match academic table stores grades subject taken (student remained past census date).

title: Working-with-enrolments
text: enrolments tables also includes pseudo-subjects, place holders Leave Absence. ‘subjects’ code XLV0000 treated like normal subject. Subjects beginning code SSS… might also needed treated differently, free subjects exhibit different behaviour students.

text: might also interested course students . toy data primarily Bachelor Nursing, however joining directly student_course table can produce errors student multiple courses. need select appropriate course, based admit_session (student entered course - however warned sometimes later first subjects course!), last_registered_session. might necessary ignore course_code field can multiple course codes single course.
code: enrolments |>      filter(session == 202230) |>      distinct(id, session) |>      inner_join(         student_course |>              select(id, course, course_code,                     admit_session, last_registered_session)) #> Joining, by = "id" #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   id       session course                                cours…¹ admit…² last_…³ #>   <chr>      <dbl> <chr>                                 <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 Student2  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130  202260 #> 2 Student4  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130      NA #> 3 Student4  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4421NS   202230  202230 #> 4 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Business (with specialis… 2421BU   202260  202260 #> 5 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Social Science (Psycholo… 2421SS   202230      NA #> 6 Student5  202230 Bachelor of Nursing                   4415NS   202130  202130 #> # exclude any courses if already completed         last_registered_session >= session | is.na(last_registered_session),         # exclude if they entered the course after the session of interest         admit_session <= session         ) |>      distinct(id, session, course) |>      ungroup() #> Joining, by = "id"  students_in_202230 #> # title: add subject context — add_subject_context
code: add_subject_context(d)

title: add subject context — add_subject_context
text: d data frame, specified

title: add subject context — add_subject_context
text: Requires data frame subject (six character code), n_remained (NA subject HEPPP last year), genuine_pass_rate, n_passed,  same_trigger (boolean) also three fields describing subject runs, s1, s2 s3. sn fields set internal, distance . blank (NA) deemed unknown subject run next.

title: add subject context — add_subject_context
code: d <- tibble::tribble(    ~subject, ~genuine_pass_rate, ~n_remained, ~n_passed, ~same_trigger, ~s1, ~s2, ~s3,    "MEH111", NA_real_, NA, NA, NA, "both", "internal", "internal",    "NUP200", 0.88, 18, 3, TRUE, NA_character_, "both", NA_character_,    "LOL101", 0.71, 15, 0, FALSE, "distance", "distance", "distance" ) d |> add_subject_context() #> Error in dplyr::mutate(d, subject_context = stringr::str_c(subject, dplyr::if_else(!is.na(n_remained),     " was in last years campaign. ", " was not in last years campaign."),     dplyr::if_else(is.na(genuine_pass_rate), "", stringr::str_c(" Around ",         round(genuine_pass_rate/0.05) * 5, "% of students who submit at least 1 assessment end up passing.")),     dplyr::if_else(is.na(n_remained), "", dplyr::if_else(n_remained ==         0, "No students in a similar position last year remained past census date.",         stringr::str_c(" Last year ", n_remained, if_else(n_remained ==             1, " student", " students"), " who were in ", dplyr::if_else(same_trigger,             "the same", "a similar"), " position remained enrolled past census and ",             dplyr::if_else(n_passed == 0, "none of them passed.",                 stringr::str_c(n_passed, " of them passed (",                   round(100 * n_passed/n_remained), "%)."))))),     dplyr::if_else((is.na(s1) & is.na(s2) & is.na(s3)), "It is unclear when this subject is run next.",         stringr::str_c(" This subject runs in:", dplyr::case_when(is.na(s1) ~             "", s1 == "both" ~ " Session 1 (internal and distance)",             s1 == "internal" ~ " Session 1 (internal only)",             s1 == "distance" ~ " Session 1 (distance only)"),             dplyr::case_when(is.na(s2) ~ "", s2 == "both" ~ " Session 2 (internal and distance)",                 s2 == "internal" ~ " Session 2 (internal only)",                 s2 == "distance" ~ " Session 2 (distance only)"),             dplyr::case_when(is.na(s3) ~ "", s3 == "both" ~ " Session 3 (internal and distance)",                 s3 == "internal" ~ " Session 3 (internal only)",                 s3 == "distance" ~ " Session 3 (distance only)"))),     ".")): Problem while computing `subject_context = stringr::str_c(...)`. #> Caused by error in `if_else()`: #> ! could not find function "if_else"

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
text: Takes n x 3 data frame calculates chi squared statistic, p-value odds ratio. First column must category names. Second column must observed values (count) Third column must expected values (also count, can weights probabilities)

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
code: chi_and_odds(m)

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
text: m n x 3 data frame tibble. variables particular order: category_name, observed_count, expected_count

title: chi and odds — chi_and_odds
code: df <- tibble::tibble(field = c('Yes', 'No') , observed = c(34, 88), expected = c(707, 1021)) chi_and_odds(df) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   field observed expected #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Yes         34      707 #> 2 No          88     1021 #>  #> $chisq.test.result #>  #> 	Chi-squared test for given probabilities #>  #> data:  observed #> X-squared = 8.5886, df = 1, p-value = 0.003383 #>  #>  #> $odds_ratio #>    observed #> 1 0.5579594 #>  #> $odds_interpretation #> [1] "Yes is 1.79224520366423 times less likely to happen in observed than in expected" #>   # or from clipboard df <- clipr::read_clip_tbl() #> Error in error_interactive(): To run write_clip() in non-interactive mode, either call write_clip() with allow_non_interactive = TRUE, or set the environment variable CLIPR_ALLOW=TRUE chi_and_odds(df) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   field observed expected #>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Yes         34      707 #> 2 No          88     1021 #>  #> $chisq.test.result #>  #> 	Chi-squared test for given probabilities #>  #> data:  observed #> X-squared = 8.5886, df = 1, p-value = 0.003383 #>  #>  #> $odds_ratio #>    observed #> 1 0.5579594 #>  #> $odds_interpretation #> [1] "Yes is 1.79224520366423 times less likely to happen in observed than in expected" #>
